meanings.definition: To make or become higher or more intense.
meanings.sent1: Adding more spices can heighten the flavor of the soup.
meanings.sent2: Turning up the volume will heighten the sound of the music.
meanings.sent3: Trying to balance on a wobbly chair will only heighten the risk of falling.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement seemed to heighten with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the sunset served to heighten the beauty of the landscape.

meanings.definition: To increase the intensity or amount of something.
meanings.sent1: A cup of coffee in the morning can heighten your energy levels.
meanings.sent2: The storm's strong winds will heighten the sense of danger.
meanings.sent3: His attempts to juggle too many tasks only served to heighten the chaos.
meanings.sent4: The suspenseful music in the movie helped heighten the audience's anticipation.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh flowers can heighten the feeling of happiness in a room.

meanings.definition: To raise in importance or value.
meanings.sent1: Receiving an award can heighten a person's sense of achievement.
meanings.sent2: A unique feature can heighten the value of a property.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a fancy hat to a casual event might heighten your embarrassment.
meanings.sent4: The rare artifact helped heighten the museum's reputation.
meanings.sent5: A sincere apology can heighten the trust between friends.
